business.headline: Sensex ends 400 points higher, Nifty jumps as heavyweight stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 498.58 points to end at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45.

NSE, BSE to keep markets open on February 1 for Union Budget 2025The practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, subscription Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.
From the world's richest to fifth: The ups and downs of Bernard Arnault Once the world's richest, Bernard Arnault lost $32 billion in 2024 but remains a luxury titan with LVMH's 75 iconic brands.

Salted, pre-packed or caramelised? Popcorn gets stuck in GST mazeThe GST Council's decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check latest GMP, share price, allotment date Mamata Machinery IPO: The price band for the IPO is set between Rs 230 and Rs 243 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot size of 61 shares, which requires a retail investment of Rs 14,823.

PM-JAY for senior citizens: How to register for free health insuranceAyushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana ensures senior citizens over 70 get free health insurance of Rs 5 lakh annually, with a simple enrolment process to make healthcare more accessible.

F&O gamble: 5 reasons why options trading is a losing game for retail tradersOne of the biggest challenges retail traders face in India is the prohibitively high transaction costs. Unlike in the US, where brokerage fees are negligible and there are no transaction taxes, Indian traders face multiple layers of charges.
GSTR-9 simplified: Filing, features, deadlines and other details GSTR-9 consolidates GST data for taxpayers exceeding Rs 2 crore turnover, ensuring accurate reconciliation and compliance.
Explained: Why India Cements share price surged 11% today Shares of India Cements rose after UltraTech Cement received a crucial approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI).
Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024: What is it and how to avail it?Settle tax disputes easily under the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by paying the disputed tax and avoiding penalties.

Sensex jumps 800 points: 3 factors behind today's stock market rallyStock Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex climbed 802.66 points to 78,844.25 by 11:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 243 points to trade at 23,828.60.

Concord Enviro IPO closes for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMP The Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 500.33 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 25 lakh shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 46 lakh shares valued at Rs 325.33 crore.

Stocks to watch today: Zomato, RIL, TCS, Vedanta, NTPC Green, Ultratech CementBoth the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 witnessed massive losses last week, with the Sensex dropping over 4,000 points across five consecutive sessions and the Nifty falling by nearly 1,200 points, marking a 5% weekly loss.

Unimech Aerospace IPO opens: Check opening date, gmp, price band, lot size Unimech Aerospace IPO: The price band for the IPO has been set at Rs 745 to Rs 785 per share. The minimum lot size for investors is 19 shares, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,915.

Dam Capital Advisors IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for bidding Dam Capital Advisors IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders, meaning the company will not receive any funds from this offering.
Sensex, Nifty snap losing streak with IT, metal surge; RIL shares up over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 577.72 points to 78,619.31, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 185.80 points to 23,773.30.

Zomato shares to be in focus today. Here's why Zomato's stock has surged nearly 43% over the last six months and approximately 126% over the past year, far outpacing the Sensex's one-year return of 10.7%.

Epigamia co-founder Rohan Mirchandani dies at 42 due to cardiac arrestRohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Epigamia, died due to cardiac arrest. Known for transforming India's food market, he led Epigamia's growth to over 20,000 retail outlets in 30 cities.

GST Council's key decisions: What's cheaper, what's costlier, and all other detailsGST Council brings key tax changes impacting everyday essentials like popcorn, used cars, fortified rice, corporate sponsorships, and penalties.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 'Her tactics raise questions': Ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar denied pre-arrest bailThe Delhi High Court on Monday dismissed the anticipatory bail plea of former IAS trainee Puja Khedkar, who has been accused of cheating and fraudulently availing benefits under the OBC quota to clear the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) exams.

Send Sheikh Hasina back: Bangladesh's diplomatic note to India Bangladesh's de facto foreign minister Touhid Hossain told reporters that the country wanted to initiate legal proceedings against Hasina

BJP targets me with chargesheets, but lacks Chief Minister face: Arvind KejriwalArvind Kejriwal countered the BJP's chargesheet against the AAP, accusing it of corruption and broken promises, and stated that the saffron party lacks an agenda for the upcoming assembly elections.

UK assures Khalistanis of protection over 'harassment by Indian agencies': ReportThe UK's junior minister of State for Security, Dan Jarvis, has assured British Sikhs of protection by the use of all government tools. His letter came after allegations by some Khalistanis of being "targeted by or on behalf of the Indian government" at airports, reports The Guardian. The claims lack credible evidence and a former diplomat has ripped into the UK for harbouring anti-India elements.

First pic: PV Sindhu marries Venkata Datta Sai in UdaipurBadminton icon PV Sindhu married Venkata Datta Sai in a grand Telugu ceremony in Udaipur, surrounded by loved ones. The couple tied the knot following traditional rituals, ahead of their Hyderabad reception on December 24.

Vinod Kambli hospitalised in Thane after health deterioratesFormer India cricketer and Sachin Tendulkar's childhood friend, Vinod Kambli, was admitted to a hospital in Thane on Saturday night after his health condition worsened.

Bangladesh is The Economist's Country of the Year; panauti, debatable, say criticsBangladesh, on the brink of an economic crisis, has been picked by The Economist as its 'Country of the Year'. The UK-based media outlet chose Bangladesh because it "ousted a despot". Critics called the choice "debatable" and some even called it "panauti", or bad omen, for the country.

High Court's necrophilia ruling: Sex with dead body horrendous but not rapeThe Chhattisgarh High Court has observed that having sex with a person's dead body was not rape even though it was one of the most horrendous acts one can think of.

18% GST on caramelised popcorn sparks meme fest online. Best ones herePopcorn GST Meme: Social media memes flooded the internet after the GST Council confirmed that caramelised popcorn would attract an 18% tax.

Congress MP counters Narayana Murthy's 70-hour week: Working longer meaninglessCongress MP Karti Chidambaram reacted to NR Narayana Murthy's 70-week workweek idea, stressing that efficiency should be the focus and not "meaningless" long working hours.

Elderly woman dies in Bhopal after son locks her inside home, goes out of cityAn elderly woman died in Bhopal due to hunger and thirst after her son locked her in a room and left for Ujjain with his family. A case has been filed against the accused son after the incident.

AUS vs IND: What to expect from the MCG pitch for the Boxing Day TestAustralia vs India, 4th Test: A good tinge of green was spotted on the centre pitch on Monday, three days ahead of Boxing Day. Melbourne Cricket Ground curator Matt Page said he expects a seam-friendly pitch with very little assistance for spinners.

Secret Santa goals? Indian employee gifts tub of dahi to colleague. Pic goes viralA man shared a photograph of a tub of dahi (curd) placed among the other Secret Santa gifts that has gone viral on social media.

Accused in Allu Arjun house attack get bail, Revanth Reddy link emergesBRS leader Krishank has claimed that one of the six accused, who got bail in actor Allu Arjun's house attack case, was an "aide" of Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy.

After Panama Canal, Trump now wants US to buy Greenland: 'Absolute necessity'Donald Trump's renewed interest in Greenland is not new as the US President-elect had made his desire known to control the territory during his first term from 2017 to 2021.
Honda, Nissan announce merger, set to form world's third-largest carmakerThe integration of Honda and Nissan will create the third-largest carmaker in the world in terms of volume.

The fight for Ambedkar's legacy signifies a big churn in Dalit politicsThe fight for Dr BR Ambedkar's legacy has sparked a political war, with the BJP and Congress accusing each other of disrespecting him. Beneath it all lies hardcore Dalit politics.

Bangladesh runs up Rs 200 crore electricity bill, Tripura to take call on supplyAccording to Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha, Bangladesh owes the state Rs 200 crore in electricity dues, but no decision has yet been taken on halting power supply to the neighbouring country.

Manu Bhaker, double Olympic medalist, not in Khel Ratna nominees list: SourcesManu Bhaker, who won two bronze medals in the Paris Olympics earlier this year, won't be getting the Khel Ratna award. Her father Ramkrishna Bhasker was disappointed after the committee did not recommend her name.

Who is Sriram Krishnan, Indian-American techie appointed Donald Trump's AI AdvisorDonald Trump stated that Sriram Krishnan will work on maintaining American leadership in AI and coordinating AI policy across the government.

He's a showman: Karan Johar, Neha Dhupia rejoice at Karan Aujla's Mumbai concertKaran Johar along with Neha Dhupia were among the other celebs to attend Karan Aujla's concert in Mumbai on December 22. Several videos from the concert have emerged online.

Omar Abdullah faces internal revolt as party MP threatens protest over quotaOmar Abdullah: Centre's decision to amend the OBC category and add Paharis to the Scheduled Tribe list, reducing open merit share, has led to dissent from Kashmiris and Dogras, two prominent communities in Jammu and Kashmir.

Kumar Vishwas invokes Ramayana in veiled dig at Shatrughan Sinha, stokes rowPoet Kumar Vishwas faced backlash for a veiled jibe at Shatrughan Sinha and Sonakshi Sinha over her interfaith marriage.  with Congress leaders condemning his remarks as "cheap" and "lewd."

Bashar al-Assad's wife files for divorce, unhappy with life in Moscow: ReportDeposed Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's wife Asma al-Assad has expressed her dissatisfaction with her life in Moscow following her husband's ouster from power by rebels.

Varun Dhawan's humble response after nutritionist corrects his black coffee remarkVarun Dhawan recently replied to a nutritionist who corrected his black coffee remark. The actor had stated that he stopped having in the morning because of his gut issues and how it can create problem for everyone later in age.

Watch: Jacqueline, Nargis Fakhri, Sonam Bajwa slay 'Kaali Activa' trendJacqueline Fernandes, Nargis Fakhri, and Sonam Bajwa embraced the viral 'Kaali Activa Trend,' dazzling fans with their chic dance video. The Housefull 5 stars impressed their fans and peers.

Watch: AP Dhillon's rumoured girlfriend Banita Sandhu at Diljit's concert amid feudAP Dhillon's rumoured girlfriend Banita Sandhu attended Diljit Dosanjh's Mumbai concert. Videos of the actor from the concert have gone viral.

Sai Pallavi visits Annapurna Devi temple, Dasaswamedh Ghat in VaranasiActor Sai Pallavi, recently cast as Sita in Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana, visited Varanasi to seek divine blessings. During her visit, she offered prayers at the Annapurna Devi temple and at the Dasaswamedh Ghat.

England name squads for Women's Ashes, MacDonald-Gay rewarded Women's Ashes 2025: 20-year-old Ryana MacDonald-Gay has been retained in the England squad for the Day-Night Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Maia Bouchier has been included in all three squads.

Ruturaj hits blazing 148 off 74 for Maharashtra in Vijay Hazare TrophyRuturaj Gaikwad's unbeaten 148 off 74 balls guided Maharashtra to a resounding victory over Services in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, which announced his promising ODI batting talent ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy.

Mbappe's adaptation period is over: Ancelotti after Sevilla winKylian Mbappe silenced critics with a stellar performance, netting a goal and an assist in Real Madrid's 4-2 victory over Sevilla, showcasing his seamless integration into the team and proving his readiness for bigger challenges ahead.

Race to Women's ODI World Cup: New Zealand in danger after defeat vs AustraliaNew Zealand are in danger of failing to automatically qualify for the ODI World Cup to be held next year in India. On Monday, the White Ferns lost to Australia by 75 runs in Wellington.

Here's why the two teams were given pitches with different nature in the lead-up to the Boxing Day Test.

Dinesh Karthik raises concern about Shubman Gill's major technical flawFormer India batter Dinesh Karthik believes that Shubman Gill has a major flaw in his technique. Gill has had a lean series so far, failing to register any fifties in his three innings.

Kohli, Jadeja's media controversies are mind games: Simon KatichFormer Australia cricketer Simon Katich has termed Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja's recent confrontations with journalists as mind games. Katich has claimed that India are trying to get an edge ahead of the MCG Test.

Historic Pakistan become 1st team to whitewash South Africa at homeSensational Saim Ayub helped Pakistan become the first team to whitewash South Africa at their own backyard in ODI bilaterals. Having won the first two matches of the series, Pakistan condemned South Africa to their third straight defeat at home on Sunday, December 22.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
